title: How to Draw Barbed Wire

steps.headline: Draw two curved lines forming the first wire.
steps.description:
They should be parallel, but not straight, as shown here. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/90\/Wire1-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/90\/Wire1-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":147,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":243.2,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Add a second set of lines.
steps.description:
Make it the mirror image of the first; they should intersect in some points. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/53\/Wire2-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/53\/Wire2-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":148,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":245.1,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw an oval covering each of the intersections.
steps.description:
They should be relatively thin and horizontal. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/24\/Joint-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/24\/Joint-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":148,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":245.1,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Add spikes to the ovals you just drew.
steps.description:
Add four or two if you want to make it a double barbed wire. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d9\/Spikes-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d9\/Spikes-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":147,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":243.2,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Add vertical lines to the ovals.
steps.description:
Make sure you leave a space between lines, similar to the thickness of the base wires you drew. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6d\/Twist-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6d\/Twist-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":148,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":245.1,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Color your drawing.
steps.description:
Use grey to mimic metal, or black to make it look like a tattoo. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/Paint-Step-6-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/Paint-Step-6-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":148,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":245.1,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}
